savedPoems.title: Test Poem
savedPoems.author: Test Author
lines: Is the poem fetched or lost in code,
Did the API yield what it showed?
In JSON fields, the words await,
But syntax errors tempt their fate.
With async dreams, we call once more,
Debugging logs, the endless chore.
Oh fetch, succeedâ€”let poems flow,
So all my testing woes can go.

savedPoems.title: Vite and TypeScript Symphony
savedPoems.author: Code Poet
lines: In the realm of code, where Vite does shine,
TypeScript joins, with types divine.
A build so swift, a dev's delight,
In every line, the future's bright.
Modules load with blazing speed,
Type safety, our noble steed.
In Vite's embrace, we find our way,
To code with joy, both night and day.
No more waits, for builds so slow,
With Vite and TypeScript, watch us grow.
In harmony, they guide our hand,
To craft the best, in code we stand.

savedPoems.title: On the Eyes of Miss a----H---
savedPoems.author: George Gordon, Lord Byron
lines: Anne's Eye is liken'd to the _Sun_,
From it such Beams of Beauty fall;
And _this_ can be denied by none,
For like the _Sun_, it shines on _All_.
Then do not admiration smother,
Or say these glances don't become her;
To _you_, or _I_, or _any other_
Her _Sun_, displays perpetual Summer.
